apiDescription: Visier APIs for sending raw or untransformed source data to Visier
metaDescription:
Visier is the people impact platform that puts the right insights in the right hands, at the right time, throughout the business.

We help organizations of all sizes unlock the power of their people data for business impact. This includes enterprises using our category-leading people analytics software, partners embedding our solution into existing apps, and developers building on the Visier platform.

As the global leader in people analytics, Visier has over 25,000 customers in 75 countries around the world, including enterprises like BASF, Bridgestone, Electronic Arts, McKesson, MerckKGaA, and more. Visier is headquartered in Vancouver, BC with offices and team members worldwide.

responses.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

methods.description: Transfer data to sources via JSON

parameters.name: transferSessionId
parameters.description: The transfer session ID returned after the data transfer session starts.

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier associated with the source you want to transfer data to.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The unique sequence number associated with a batch of records.

parameters.name: tenantCode
parameters.description: The code of the tenant you want to transfer data to. For example, WFF_j1r or WFF_j1r~c7o.

responses.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

parameters.name: transferSessionId
parameters.description: The transfer session ID to cancel.

responses.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

methods.description: Transfer data to sources via file upload

parameters.name: transferSessionId
parameters.description: The transfer session ID returned after the data transfer session starts.

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier associated with the source you want to transfer data to.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The unique sequence number associated with a batch of records.

parameters.name: tenantCode
parameters.description: The code of the tenant you want to transfer data to. For example, WFF_j1r or WFF_j1r~c7o.

responses.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

methods.description: Retrieve processing job statuses by receiving job ID

parameters.name: tenantCode
parameters.description: The tenant code of the tenant you want to retrieve the processing jobs for. Use this if you are only interested in the results for one analytic tenant.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of processing jobs to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The index to start retrieving results from, also known as offset. The index begins at 0.

responses.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

parameters.name: receivingJobId
parameters.description: The **dataReceivingJobId** provided after a data transfer session completes. See **`/v1/op/jobs/receiving-jobs`**.

parameters.name: jobs
parameters.description: If true, returns the status of receiving jobs spawned by the receiving job specified by receivingJobId.

parameters.name: tenantCode
parameters.description: The tenant code of the tenant you want to retrieve the receiving jobs for. Use this if you are only interested in the results for one analytic tenant.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The index to start retrieving results from, also known as offset. The index begins at 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of job statuses to return per page.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

methods.description: Upload a data file to Visier

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The filename of the data file to upload, including the file extension (such as .zip or .csv).

repositoryDescription: Visier is a global leader in people analytics, providing software solutions to unlock the power of people data for businesses worldwide. With over 25,000 customers in 75 countries, Visier is trusted by enterprises like BASF, Bridgestone, and Electronic Arts. Visier's {language} SDK for DataIntake API generated by Konfig (https://konfigthis.com/).
typescriptSdkFirstRequestCode:
// Retrieve a list of sources
const getSourcesResponse = visierDataIntake.dataIntake.getSources()
